titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Henry Mitchell, Indictment
CWG4991

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Henry Mitchell

The Grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky; accuse Henry Mitchell of the offence of selling Spiritous Liquor to an Infant, Committed as follows, viz:

The said Henry Mitchell on the 30" day of August 1860 in the County aforesaid, did sell Spiritous Liquor to Moses H. Hester, Said Moses H Hester Being an infant under the age of Twenty one years and without the written Consent or request of the father, mother or Guardians of said infant, Moses H. Hester--against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

H. E. Kennedy
Foreman Grand Jury
Information Given by
Merriell A. Christian
Lemuel C. Glenn
Moses H. Hester

A Copy attest
Ben T. Perkins Jr D. C.
for Ben T. Perkins C. T. C. C.

Commonwealth of Ky
vs } copy of Indictment
Henry MitchellA. True Bill
H. E. Kennedy
Foreman Grand Jury
